com.xd.cps2002.game

Class HTMLGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xd.cps2002.game.HTMLGenerator

  • public class HTMLGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    The HTMLGenerator class is responsible for generating the HTML maps for each player. It implements a Singleton design pattern, to allow for better resource management and provide better control over writing to the generated HTML files. By decoupling the CSS style definitions of the tiles from this generator, the possibility to add new tile types is greatly simplified.

    • Method Detail

      • getHTMLGenerator

        public static HTMLGenerator getHTMLGenerator()
        Returns an HTMLGenerator instance; in the case that an instance already exists, it returns the exisiting one. Else it creates a new instance and returns it.
        Returns:
        HTMLGenerator instance is the singleton to be returned.

      • dereferenceHTMLGenerator

        public static void dereferenceHTMLGenerator()
        Dereferences the HTMLGenerator instance to null.

      • genPlayerMap

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> genPlayerMap(Player player,
                                                          Map map)
        Responsible for generating the HTML map, as a structured String ArrayList
        Parameters:
        player - is a Player instance for which a map will be generated.
        map - is a Map instance on which the HTML map will be based.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of type String with the lines of the HTML file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - whenever the Player or Map instances passed are null.
        NullTeamException - is thrown when Team team is null, i.e. when it has not been set.
